citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
2.31 (a) Northern Virginia Community College Veterinary Technician Program has not identified a new Institutional Official
(IO). The prior IO left the facility in April 2023.
The IO is authorized to legally commit on behalf of the College that the standards and regulations of the Animal Welfare
Act (9 CFR) are met. An IO must be identified to officially appoint Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC)
members who will be responsible for instituting the animal care and use program in accordance with subpart 2.31 and the
standards outlined in the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by March 31, 2025.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The nonaffiliated member, veterinarian, and several other members of the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
(IACUC) were not appointed by an Institutional Official (IO) of the teaching facility.
In accordance with Animal Welfare Regulations, the members of the IACUC shall be appointed by the IO of the teaching
facility. IACUC members must be appointed by the IO to ensure that members are aware or their role in overseeing the
animal care and use program at the facility. This appointment must be documented to show that the IO has ensured
qualified members are a part of the IACUC tasked with assessing the animal program, facilities, and procedures. Correct
by March 31, 2025.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
2.31(b)(2) A non-voting member of the committee was asked to lead the March and October 2024 meetings. The
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) Committee does not have an appointed Chair. The prior Chair of
the IACUC left facility April 2023.
An established IACUC consists of at least three persons, one of which is a chairperson. A chairperson must be a part of
the IACUC to ensure properly convened meetings, effective review and implementation of protocols and the animal
program. An IACUC chair must be appointed per Animal Welfare Act regulations and standards. Correct by March 31,
2025.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
In 2024, the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) did not review the research facility's Program for
Humane Care and Use of Animals at least once every six months as required per this Section of the Regulations. The
program reviews were conducted on March 12, 2024, and December 19, 2024. There were 9 months between the
program reviews. Also, records reviewed did not identify significant program deficiencies such as,
1. No Institutional Official
2. No IACUC Chairperson
3. IACUC members that have not been appointed by the Institutional Official
4. Animals used for teaching under 3 expired protocols
A facility's animal care program shall be evaluated by the IACUC at least once every 6 months to ensure that all aspects
of the animal care program are being conducted appropriately
for the welfare of the animals being used at the teaching facility. The IACUC must conduct a thorough review of the
facility's Program for Humane Care and Use of Animals and note all deficiencies. Correct by March 31, 2025.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
2.31(c)(3). Semi-annual program and facility reviews were conducted but the prepared reports of the evaluations were
incomplete. Deficiencies noted were not distinguished as significant or minor. Also, a reasonable and specific plan and
schedule with correction dates for the deficiencies was not established. Additionally, the reports of the evaluations were
not signed by the majority of the members. Finally, these reports were not submitted to the Institutional Official (IO).
NOTE: The facility did not have a designated IO from April 2023 thru March 2025.
Reports documenting semi-annual of the program and facility reviews must be prepared in accordance with the
regulations of the Animal Welfare Act, including submission of these reports to the IO at least once every six months to
ensure the humane care and use of the animals. The report must be signed by a majority of the Committee members and
include a statement pertaining to minority views, identify any deficiency as a minor or significant deficiency, and include
details of a plan for correction. Correct By March 31, 2025, and with each subsequent review.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During the October 2024 meeting, new principal investigators were assigned to the existing teaching protocols. The
following protocols were due for the 3-year review but were not reviewed and approved by the IACUC: CVTEA Essential
Horse Skills Lab (exp 11/10/23), VET 217 Rabbit Skills (exp 10/24/24), VET 221(10/24/24).
All animal activities must be completely reviewed and approved by the IACUC no less than every 3 years, to ensure that
the animal activities at the facility are conducted in accordance with the Animal Welfare Act regulations and standards.
The IACUC must review and approve all expired protocols. Correct by April 18, 2025.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility houses cats, rabbits, and dogs. These species were used in teaching labs from October 2024 to March 2025,
after the protocols expired on 10/24/24. Animals must not be used for teaching when a protocol is expired. Principle
investigators must ensure proposed activities have been reviewed and approved by the IACUC at appropriate intervals
before using animals for teaching purposes.
Proposed activities and proposed significant changes in ongoing activities that have been approved by the IACUC may be
subject to further appropriate review and approval by officials of the research facility. However, those officials may not
approve an activity involving the care and use of animals if it has not been approved by the IACUC. Correct by March 31.
2025.

Current members of the IACUC do not fully understand their role and responsibilities and have not received adequate
IACUC training. In 2024, the IACUC conducted two meetings that included semi-annual inspections. However, they failed
to address the identified key deficiencies. The IACUC did not discuss or seek a replacement Institutional Official or
chairperson. They did not officially appoint an IACUC chair. Expiring protocols were not reviewed, approved, and signed
by committee members. Semi-annual reports were not properly prepared.
It shall be the responsibility of the research facility to ensure that all personnel involved in animal care, treatment, and use
are qualified to perform their duties. This responsibility shall be fulfilled in part through the provision of training and
instruction to those personnel. Training and instruction shall be made available, and the qualifications of personnel
reviewed, with sufficient frequency to fulfill the teaching facility's responsibilities under this section and Sec. 2.31. Trained
IACUC members ensure the animal care and use program at the facility is in compliance with the regulations and
standards of the Animal Welfare Act. All IACUC members must be provided training and continuing education so that the
Committee members can effectively serve in their roles and perform the IACUC responsibilities. Correct April 18, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
NOTE: The inspection of facilities and a partial records review was conducted on February 20, 2025. A final records
review was conducted on March 10, 2025 after key personnel were identified for the review and discussion.
